addressleaf.section:
To the right honorable my very singular good Lord
e L. Burghley Lord highe Treasurer of England.

10 Junij
1591
. M
r
Bodeleie to my L./

page.lettertext:
fol.130r
May it please yo
r
good L. being come to
Amster-
dam
, I have go tten those writinges, for w
ch
yo
r
L.
writte unto me. There is nothing missing but
e letter of
Lucas Veler
to his frind in Amsterd
a
:
w
ch
I will cause notw
t
standing, to be required of
the shipper, who is nowe out of towne: though it
seeme by
e letter, w
ch
yo
r
L. sent,
at it was but
written in recommendation of
Snowden.
I have
sent yo
w
all together, in those budgets in w
ch
they
were found, and packed the whole in canvas, w
ch
I have delivered to a messenger of
Zeland,
and
given order from thens for good conveiance to yo
r
L.
I am going as this day for
Friseland,
where
I heare that
Count Maurice
and
e
Councell of state
are already arrived. But as yet
e Councell is
uncertain where they shall sejorne: albeit I
thinke it will be
Doccum
or
Leewarden:
wherof
I shall advertise, assoone as I am setled.
And so
for this present I take my humble leave.
At Amsterdam. June 10 1591.
Yo
r
L. most humbly bounden Tho. Bodley
